segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 4. Devadūtavagga
segments.en: 4. Messengers of the Gods

segments.pli: 34. Nidānasutta
segments.en: 34. Sources

segments.pli: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Lobho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, doso nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, moho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: Greed, hate, and delusion are sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, lobhapakataṃ kammaṃ lobhajaṃ lobhanidānaṃ lobhasamudayaṃ, yatthassa attabhāvo nibbattati tattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati.
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from greed—born, sourced, and originated from greed—ripens where that new life-form is born.

segments.pli: Yattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati tattha tassa kammassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, diṭṭhe vā dhamme upapajja vā apare vā pariyāye.
segments.en: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, or in the next life, or in some subsequent period.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, dosapakataṃ kammaṃ dosajaṃ dosanidānaṃ dosasamudayaṃ, yatthassa attabhāvo nibbattati tattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati.
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from hate—born, sourced, and originated from hate—ripens where that new life-form is born.

segments.pli: Yattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati tattha tassa kammassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, diṭṭhe vā dhamme upapajja vā apare vā pariyāye.
segments.en: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, or in the next life, or in some subsequent period.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, mohapakataṃ kammaṃ mohajaṃ mohanidānaṃ mohasamudayaṃ, yatthassa attabhāvo nibbattati tattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati.
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from delusion—born, sourced, and originated from delusion—ripens where that new life-form is born.

segments.pli: Yattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati tattha tassa kammassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, diṭṭhe vā dhamme upapajja vā apare vā pariyāye.
segments.en: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, or in the next life, or in some subsequent period.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, bījāni akhaṇḍāni apūtīni avātātapahatāni sārādāni sukhasayitāni sukhette suparikammakatāya bhūmiyā nikkhittāni.
segments.en: Suppose some seeds were intact, unspoiled, not weather-damaged, fertile, and well-kept. They’re sown in a well-prepared, productive field,

segments.pli: Devo ca sammādhāraṃ anuppaveccheyya.
segments.en: and the heavens provide plenty of rain.

segments.pli: Evassu tāni, bhikkhave, bījāni vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjeyyuṃ.
segments.en: Then those seeds would grow, increase, and mature.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yaṃ lobhapakataṃ kammaṃ lobhajaṃ lobhanidānaṃ lobhasamudayaṃ, yatthassa attabhāvo nibbattati tattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati.
segments.en: In the same way, any deed that emerges from greed—born, sourced, and originated from greed—ripens where that new life-form is born.

segments.pli: Yattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati tattha tassa kammassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, diṭṭhe vā dhamme upapajja vā apare vā pariyāye.
segments.en: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, or in the next life, or in some subsequent period.

segments.pli: Yaṃ dosapakataṃ kammaṃ … pe …
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from hate …

segments.pli: yaṃ mohapakataṃ kammaṃ mohajaṃ mohanidānaṃ mohasamudayaṃ, yatthassa attabhāvo nibbattati tattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati.
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from delusion—born, sourced, and originated from delusion—ripens where that new life-form is born.

segments.pli: Yattha taṃ kammaṃ vipaccati tattha tassa kammassa vipākaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, diṭṭhe vā dhamme upapajja vā apare vā pariyāye.
segments.en: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, or in the next life, or in some subsequent period.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Alobho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, adoso nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya, amoho nidānaṃ kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: Contentment, love, and understanding are sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, alobhapakataṃ kammaṃ alobhajaṃ alobhanidānaṃ alobhasamudayaṃ, lobhe vigate evaṃ taṃ kammaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṅkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ.
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from contentment—born, sourced, and originated from contentment—is given up when greed is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, adosapakataṃ kammaṃ adosajaṃ adosanidānaṃ adosasamudayaṃ, dose vigate evaṃ taṃ kammaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṅkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ.
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from love—born, sourced, and originated from love—is abandoned when hate is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, amohapakataṃ kammaṃ amohajaṃ amohanidānaṃ amohasamudayaṃ, mohe vigate evaṃ taṃ kammaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṅkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ.
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from understanding—born, sourced, and originated from understanding—is abandoned when delusion is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, bījāni akhaṇḍāni apūtīni avātātapahatāni sārādāni sukhasayitāni.
segments.en: Suppose some seeds were intact, unspoiled, not damaged by wind and sun, fertile, and well-kept.

segments.pli: Tāni puriso agginā ḍaheyya.
segments.en: But someone would burn them with fire,

segments.pli: Agginā ḍahitvā masiṃ kareyya.
segments.en: reduce them to ashes,

segments.pli: Masiṃ karitvā mahāvāte vā ophuṇeyya nadiyā vā sīghasotāya pavāheyya.
segments.en: and sweep away the ashes in a strong wind, or float them away down a swift stream.

segments.pli: Evassu tāni, bhikkhave, bījāni ucchinnamūlāni tālāvatthukatāni anabhāvaṃkatāni āyatiṃ anuppādadhammāni.
segments.en: Then those seeds would be cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

segments.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yaṃ alobhapakataṃ kammaṃ alobhajaṃ alobhanidānaṃ alobhasamudayaṃ, lobhe vigate evaṃ taṃ kammaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti ucchinnamūlaṃ tālāvatthukataṃ anabhāvaṃkataṃ āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, any deed that emerges from contentment—born, sourced, and originated from contentment—is abandoned when greed is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

segments.pli: Yaṃ adosapakataṃ kammaṃ … pe …
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from love …

segments.pli: yaṃ amohapakataṃ kammaṃ amohajaṃ amohanidānaṃ amohasamudayaṃ, mohe vigate evaṃ taṃ kammaṃ pahīnaṃ hoti … pe …
segments.en: Any deed that emerges from understanding—born, sourced, and originated from understanding—is abandoned when delusion is done away with.

segments.pli: āyatiṃ anuppādadhammaṃ.
segments.en: It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāyāti.
segments.en: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Lobhajaṃ dosajañceva,
segments.en: When an ignorant person acts

segments.pli: mohajañcāpaviddasu;
segments.en: out of greed, hate, or delusion,

segments.pli: Yaṃ tena pakataṃ kammaṃ,
segments.en: any deeds they have performed

segments.pli: appaṃ vā yadi vā bahuṃ;
segments.en: —whether a little or a lot—

segments.pli: Idheva taṃ vedaniyaṃ,
segments.en: are to be experienced right here,

segments.pli: vatthu aññaṃ na vijjati.
segments.en: not in any other place.

segments.pli: Tasmā lobhañca dosañca,
segments.en: So a wise person,

segments.pli: mohajañcāpi viddasu;
segments.en: a mendicant arousing knowledge

segments.pli: Vijjaṃ uppādayaṃ bhikkhu,
segments.en: of the outcome of greed, hate, and delusion,

segments.pli: sabbā duggatiyo jahe”ti.
segments.en: abandons all bad destinations.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise…

suttaplex.blurb: Greed, hate, and delusion, and their opposites, are like seeds.
